pageContext.claim: “They're keeping them closed because they want -- on November 3rd they want to have the numbers as bad as possible.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump often claimed that state and local officials were keeping coronavirus restrictions in place only to hurt his chances of being reelected, and would be lifting them as soon as the Nov. 3 election ended. But the restrictions had nothing to do with Trump's campaign. Coronavirus cases were rising across the U.S. in the months leading up to the election. The restrictions remained in place after the Nov. 3 vote.
